text.title: NP-relative clause - distribution of demostratives and determiners(32 sentences, Release 1.0)
text.body:
Ama hyɛ ataadeɛ

Kofi redidi

Nkwadaa pɛ sika

Wɔfa maa me sika

Kwame too Esi Nkra

Saa abofra yi bɛfe

Ɔbo dan no yɛ fɛ

Akura yi awe me sika

Mpa kɛseɛ nkɔ dan no mu

Ntoma nsia bɛso

Nnipa nyinaa pɛ Yesu asɛm

abɔfra a ɔbɛkyeaa me no kɔ

Kofi papa bɛba ɔkyena

Ne papa bɛba ɔkyena

Aboa kɛseɛ no aduane asa

Papa no fie no yɛ fɛ

Papa kɛseɛ no baa ha

Papa kɛseɛ bi baa ha

Papa kɛseɛ yi baa ha

Papa akɛseɛ nsia yi baa ha

Papa akɛseɛ nsia yi nyinaa baa ha

Kofi mmoa akɛseɛ no awu

Yɛn mmoa akɛseɛ yi awu

W’aboa kɛseɛ bi awu

Me mmoa akɛseɛ a wɔbaa ha no nyinaa awu

Abaayewa a ɔbɛkyeaa me yi kɔ

Abaayewa no a ɔbɛkyeaa me nnora no kɔ

Abaayewa yi a ɔbɛkyeaa me yi kɔ

Abaayewa yi a ɔbɛkyeaa me no kɔ

Abaayewa no a ɔbɛkyeaa me yi kɔ

Abaayewa yi a ɔbɛkyeaa me kɔ

Abaayewa no a ɔbɛkyeaa me kɔ

Unmatched phrases (TC could not identify those phrases and appended them here, feel free to move them around):

Abɔfra a ɔbɛkyeaa me no kɔ

phrase.translation: Ama is wearing a dress.
Kofi is eating.
Children like money.
Uncle gave me money.
Kwame sent Esi a message
This child will throw up
The/that cave is beautiful.
This mouse has eaten my money

phrase.original: Mpa kɛseɛ nkɔ dan no mu
phrase.translation: The big bed cannot enter the room
Six cloths will be enough.
Everybody likes Jesus

phrase.original: Abɔfra a ɔbɛkyeaa me no kɔ
phrase.translation: The child who came to greet me has gone.
Kofi's father will come tomorrow.
His/her father will come tomorrow.
The big animal's food is finished.

phrase.original: Papa no fie no yɛ fɛ
phrase.translation: The man's house is beautiful.
The big man came here.
Some big man came here
This big man came here.

phrase.original: Papa akɛseɛ nsia yi baa ha
phrase.translation: These big men came here.

phrase.original: Papa akɛseɛ nsia yi nyinaa baa ha
phrase.translation: All these big men came here
Kofi's big animals have died.
These big animals of ours have died.
Some big animal of yours has died.

phrase.original: Me mmoa akɛseɛ a wɔbaa ha no nyinaa awu
phrase.translation: All of those my big animals which came here have died,

phrase.original: Abaayewa a ɔbɛkyeaa me yi kɔ
phrase.translation: This girl who came to greet me has gone.

phrase.original: Abaayewa no a ɔbɛkyeaa me nnora no kɔ
phrase.translation: That girl who came to greet me yesterday has gone.

phrase.original: Abaayewa yi a ɔbɛkyeaa me yi kɔ
phrase.translation: This girl who came to greet me has gone.

phrase.original: Abaayewa yi a ɔbɛkyeaa me no kɔ
phrase.translation: That girl who came to greet me has gone.

phrase.original: Abaayewa no a ɔbɛkyeaa me yi kɔ
phrase.translation: The girl who came to greet me has gone.

phrase.original: Abaayewa yi a ɔbɛkyeaa me kɔ
phrase.translation: This girl who came to greet me has gone.

phrase.original: Abaayewa no a ɔbɛkyeaa me kɔ
phrase.translation: That girl who came to greet me has gone

text.title: Noun phrases (12 sentences, Release 1.0)
text.body:
obaa kɔkɔɔ kɛsi nimdzifoɔ na otina hɔ no

ɔbaa kɛsi kɔkɔɔ ɔkwadzofo no

bɛɛma tuntuu kitikiti papa no

bɛɛma kitikiti tuntuu papa no

saa nkramai mienu no

ɔbaa ɔɔtu nyom wɔ asɔre no 

akwadaa ɛɛba yɛ hɔ no 

akwadaa ɛɛba yɛ hɔ no  

nkoadaa fɛfɛɛfɛ no nyinaa ɛɛba yɛ ho na omɔshɛ atadeɛ kɔkɔɔ no 

bɛɛma ɔɔbɔ bɔɔlu no

Kwesi bɛ-yɛ edzuma no.

obɛdzi edziban no.

phrase.original: ɔbaa kɔkɔɔ kɛsi nimdzifoɔ na otina hɔ no
phrase.translation: The beautiful, big, intelligent lady that is seated there
the fat fair lazy woman
The good little black man
The good little black man
Those two beautiful dogs

phrase.original: ɔbaa ɔɔtu nyom wɔ asɔre no
phrase.translation: The lady singing in the church/choir
The child coming towards us

phrase.original: nkoadaa fɛfɛɛfɛ no nyinaa ɛɛbayɛ ho na omɔshɛ atadeɛ kɔkɔɔ no
phrase.translation: All the handsome children coming towards us they wear red dresses.
The man playing the football
the future work doing Kwesi
S/he will eat the food

text.title: mbáá nó nòá-à ǹdùań pìí (12 sentences, Release 1.0)
text.body:
mbáá nó nòá-à ǹdùań pìí

òbí frέ-ὲ mè ànáa

ↄ’ nòá-à àdùané

ásíèdù k ↄ’ ↄ’ sùkúù ndέrá

ↄ’ kyèrέw-w nhómá

mè bá-è nò ná ↄ rè-dìdí

mè bá-è nò ná ↄ’ dìdí

ná ↄ’ kyèrέw nhómá

o dù-ì

o dìdí-ì

shá

papa lɛ

phrase.translation: The women cooked a lot of food.
Did someone call me?
he/ she cooked food.

phrase.original: ásíèdù k ↄ’ ↄ’ sùkúù ndέrá
phrase.translation: ásíèdù went to school yesterday.
he wrote the letters.

phrase.original: mè bá-è nò ná ↄ rè-dìdí
phrase.translation: I came to him while he was eating.

phrase.original: mè bá-è nò ná ↄ’ dìdí
phrase.translation: I came to him when he was eating.
He writes letters.
he ate.
wash/clean
The man

text.title: Bono (2 sentences, Release 1.0)
text.body:
sε adwumawura ma obi a ne mbere aso pɔn ne ho a ɛde anigyeɛ ba

Adwumawura no ma ɔgyae adwuma

phrase.translation: The boss made him/her stop working

phrase.original: sε adwumawura ma obi a ne mbere aso pɔn ne ho a ɛde anigyeɛ ba
phrase.translation: If the Boss allows an apprentice whose time is up to graduate, it brings happiness

text.title: Ananse ne akyekyedeɛ (Asante) (83 sentences, Release 1.0)
text.titleTranslation: Spider and turtle (a translation of an English written version of this West African Fable
text.body:
Da bi, ananse kɔtuu bayerɛ akɛsie dɛdɛbi firi n'afuo mu

Onyaa abotare totoo bayerɛ no ma na etu hwa yie

ɛsiane sɛ na ɛyɛ dɛ nti na ɔpɛ sɛ odi no ntɛm

Ankyɛ biara na ɔtee sɛ obi rebɔ ne pono mu

Na ɛyɛ akyekyedeɛ na ɔrebɔ pono no mu

Na akyekyedeɛ firi akwantuo mu nti na waberɛ

Afei nso na ɛkɔm de no yie

Akyekyedeɛ kakyerɛɛ ananse sɛ ɔnam na bayerɛ bi pampan faa ne hwene mu

na esiane sɛ ɛkɔm de no nti

ɔyɛɛ n'adwene sɛ ɔbɛba abɛserɛ no

sɛ ɔbɛma no bi adi a

Na ɛyɛ amaneɛ wɔ kurom hɔ sɛ sɛ obi srɛ wo aduane a

ɛsɛ sɛ wo ma no bi

enti na ananse ntumi nka sɛ daabi

Ananse yɛ pɛsɛmenkomenya

nti na ɔmpɛ sɛ ɔma akyekyedeɛ bayerɛ no bi di.

ɔbɔɔ pɔ wɔ ne tiri mu sɛ ɔmma no ndi bayerɛ no bi.

Ananse buee ɛpono no ma akyekyedeɛ wuraa ɛdan no mu

Na ɔmaa no akonwa tenaa so

Akyekyedeɛ tenee ne nsa sɛ ɔrebɛyi bayerɛ no bi pɛ

na ananse teaa no kaa sɛ

wonnim sɛ yɛhohoro yɛnsa ansa na yadidi

Akyekyedeɛ hwɛɛ ne nsa mu

ampa nso na emu ayɛ fi paa yie

nti ɔsɔree sɛ kɔɔ nsuo bi a na ɛda hɔ ho

sɛ ɔre kɔ hohoro ne nsa.

ɔsan baa dan no mu no na ananse ahyɛaseɛ redi aduane no

Ananse kakyerɛɛ akyekyedeɛ sɛ

na ɔmpɛ sɛ aduane no bɛdwo

nti na ɔhyɛɛ aseɛ dii aduane no

nti sɛ waba deɛ a obetumi abɛdi bi

Akyekyedeɛ tenaa ase biom

na nso ɔsan tenee ne nsa sɛ ɔreyi aduane no bi pɛ

na ananse san tea mu bisaa no sɛ

enti wante sɛ yɛnfa nsa fin ndidi

Akyekyedeɛ hwɛɛ ne nsa mu huu sɛ asan ayɛ fin biom

nti ɔsɔre san kɔɔ nsuo no ho sɛ ɔrekɔhohoro ne nsa.

esiane sɛ na ɔmpɛ sɛ ne nsa mu bɛyɛ fin biom no nti

ɔwieeɛ no ɔnantee nsensan no so baa nakyi

sɛ deɛ ɛbɛyɛ a ne nsa mu nyɛ fin biom.

Awerɛhosɛm ne sɛ oduruu dan no mu no

na ananse adi aduane no awie.

Anokwa ɛhyee akyekyedeɛ yie nanso wanka hwee.

ɔhwɛɛ ananse anim kakra na ɔdaa no ase .

ɔkakyerɛɛ ananse sɛ berɛ biara ɔbɛfa ne fie ho no

ɛyɛ a ɔnwura mu na ɔmbɛdidi

Adufuropɛ nti, akyekyedeɛ asɛm no yɛɛ ananse dɛ

Dakoro bi, ɔyɛɛ n'adwenen sɛ ɔbɛkɔ akyekyedeɛ fie akɔdidi.

ɔkɔtoo sɛ akyekyedeɛ da nsuo bi ano reto awia

Akyekyedeɛ pagyaa ne ti na ɔhuu ananse

ɔmaa no akwaaba bisaa no sɛ aduane no nti na waba anaa

ma ananse nso kaa sɛ aane

Da no nso deɛ na ɛkɔm de ananse yie

Akyekyedeɛ kɔɔ ne fie wɔ nsuo no ase kɔtoo pono kamakama bi

Ankyɛ biara na opue baa nsuo no ani

bɛkakyerɛɛ ananse sɛ aduane no abene nti ɔmbɛdidi

ɛhɔ ara na akyekyedeɛ too ne ho wuraa nsuo no ase

hyɛɛ aseɛ sɛ ɔredi aduane no

Ananse nso too neho sɛ ɔrewura nsuo no ase

nanso esiane sɛ nemu yɛ hare no nti

wantumi anwura aseɛ

ɔyɛɛ biara nanso na ntumi nwura nsuo no mu

ne nyinaa akyi nso na akyekyedeɛ deɛ ɔredi aduane no

Ananse twaa ne ho twaa ne ho saa

na afei dwene bi baa tiri mu

ɔhyɛɛ aseɛ sesaa aboɔ guu gyakɛti bi a na ɛhyɛ no mu

maa ne mu yɛɛ duru

Esiane sɛ ne mu yɛɛ duru no nti

otumi too neho too nsuo no ase.

ɔkɔtenaa ɛpono no ho

Na nnuane beberee sisi so

Ananse faa aduane no bi sɛ ɔrebɛdi ara pɛ na akyekyedeɛ kaa sɛ ɔntwɛn

Akyekyedeɛ kakyerɛɛ no sɛ

ne kurom hɔ deɛ

yɛnhyɛ gyakɛti ndidi

enti gyesɛ ɔworɔ

Ananse worɔɔ gyakɛti no ara pɛ

Na ɛhurii no bɛtoo nsuo no ani

ɔhwɛɛ nsuo no ase no

na akyekyedeɛ gu so redi aduane no

ɛhyɛɛ ananse yie

nanso mpaninfoɔ se

sɛ wani te beberee a woma apɔnkye akye

ɔmaa no akonwa tenaa so

ɔnyaa abotare totoo bayerɛ no ma na etu hwa yie

"wonnim sɛ yɛhohoro yɛnsa ansa na yadidi"

sɛ ɔrekɔ hohoro ne nsa.

nanso ɔsan tenee ne nsa sɛ ɔreyi aduane no bi pɛ

na ananse san tea mu bisaa no...

ɔkakyerɛɛ ananse sɛ berɛ biara ɔbɛfa ne fie ho no ...

na afei adwene bi baa ne tiri mu

ɔmaa no akonwa tenaa so

phrase.original: Da bi, ananse kɔtuu bayerɛ akɛseɛ dɛdɛ bi firi n'afuo mu
phrase.translation: One day, Spider went to uproot some big and tasty yams from his farm

phrase.original: ɔnyaa abotare totoo bayerɛ no ma na etu hwa yie
phrase.translation: He patiently roasted the yam and it smelled very well

phrase.original: ɛsiane sɛ na ɛyɛ dɛ nti na ɔpɛ sɛ ɔdi no ntɛm
phrase.translation: because they were sweet, he wanted to eat them quickly

phrase.original: Ankyɛ biara na ɔtee sɛ obi rebɔ ne pono mu
phrase.translation: Not long afterwards, he heard that someone was knocking at his door

phrase.original: Na ɛyɛ akyekyedeɛ na ɔrebɔ pono no mu
phrase.translation: It was turtle who was knocking at the door

phrase.original: Na akyekyedeɛ firi akwantuo mu nti na ɔaberɛ
phrase.translation: Turtle was returning from a journey so he was tired

phrase.original: Afei nso na ɛkɔm de no yie
phrase.translation: And also he was very hungry

phrase.original: Akyekyedeɛ ka kyerɛɛ ananse sɛ ɔnam na bayerɛ bi pampan faa ne hwene mu
phrase.translation: Turtle told spider that he was walking around and he smelled the scent/aroma of yam

phrase.original: na esiane sɛ ɛkɔm de no nti
phrase.translation: and because he is hungry

phrase.original: ɔyɛɛ n'adwene sɛ ɔbɛba abɛserɛ no
phrase.translation: he made up his mind that he will come and beg him

phrase.original: sɛ ɔbɛma no bi adi a
phrase.translation: if he will give him some to eat

phrase.original: Na ɛyɛ amaneɛ wɔ kurom hɔ sɛ sɛ obi srɛ wo aduane a
phrase.translation: It was a custom in the town that if someone begs you for food...

phrase.original: ɛsɛ sɛ wo ma no bi
phrase.translation: you have to give him/her some

phrase.original: enti na ananse ntumi nka sɛ daabi
phrase.translation: so ananse could not say no
ananse is greedy

phrase.original: nti na ɔmpɛ sɛ ɔma akyekyedeɛ bayerɛ no bi di.
phrase.translation: so he did not want to give turtle some of the yam to eat

phrase.original: ɔbɔɔ pɔ wɔ ne tiri mu sɛ ɔmma no ndi bayerɛ no bi.
phrase.translation: he made a point in his mind that he will not allow turtle to eat some of the yam

phrase.original: Ananse buee ɛpono no ma akyekyedeɛ wuraa ɛdan no mu
phrase.translation: Ananse opened the door for turtle to enter the room

phrase.original: Na ɔmaa no akonwa tenaa so
phrase.translation: and he gave him a chair to sit on (it)

phrase.original: Akyekyedeɛ tenee ne nsa sɛ ɔrebɛyi bayerɛ no bi pɛ
phrase.translation: Just as turtle stretched his hand to remove some of the yam,

phrase.original: na ananse teaa no kaa sɛ
phrase.translation: and spider shouted at him saying that

phrase.original: "wonnim sɛ yɛhohoro yɛn nsa ansa na yadidi"
phrase.translation: dont you know that we wash our hands before we eat?
Turtle looked at his palms

phrase.original: ampa nso na emu ayɛ fi paa yie
phrase.translation: Truly, it was very dirty

phrase.original: nti ɔsɔre kɔɔ nsuo bi a na ɛda hɔ ho
phrase.translation: so he got up and went to a river that was there
that he was going to wash his hands

phrase.original: ɔsan baa dan no mu no na ananse ahyɛ aseɛ redi aduane no
phrase.translation: when he came back to the room, ananse had already started eating the food
Ananse told turtle that...

phrase.original: na ɔmpɛ sɛ aduane no bɛdwo
phrase.translation: he didnt want the food to get cold

phrase.original: nti na ɔhyɛɛ aseɛ dii aduane no
phrase.translation: that is why he started to eat the food

phrase.original: nti sɛ ɔaba deɛ a ɔbɛtumi abɛdi bi
phrase.translation: so if he has come he can come and eat some
Turtle sat down again

phrase.original: nanso ɔsan tenee ne nsa sɛ ɔreyi aduane no bi pɛ
phrase.translation: but again, when he stretched his hand to take some of the food...

phrase.original: na ananse san teaa mu bisaa no...
phrase.translation: spider again shouted and asked him ...

phrase.original: enti woante sɛ yɛmfa nsa fin ndidi
phrase.translation: so didn't you hear that we don't eat with dirty hands

phrase.original: Akyekyedeɛ hwɛɛ ne nsa mu huu sɛ asan ayɛ fin biom
phrase.translation: turtle looked at his hands and saw that it had become dirty again

phrase.original: nti ɔsɔre san kɔɔ nsuo no ho sɛ ɔrekɔhohoro ne nsa.
phrase.translation: so he got up again to go to the river side to wash his hands

phrase.original: esiane sɛ na ɔmpɛ sɛ ne nsa mu bɛyɛ fin biom no nti
phrase.translation: because he didnt want his hands to become dirty again so

phrase.original: ɔwieeɛ no ɔnantee nsensan no so baa n'akyi
phrase.translation: when he finished, he walked on the grass on his way back

phrase.original: sɛ deɛ ɛbɛyɛ a ne nsa mu nyɛ fin biom.
phrase.translation: so that his hands will not become dirty again

phrase.original: Awerɛhosɛm ne sɛ ɔduruu dan no mu no
phrase.translation: sadly, when he got to the room...

phrase.original: na ananse adi aduane no awie.
phrase.translation: and spider had finished eating the food

phrase.original: Anokwa ɛhyee akyekyedeɛ yie nanso ɔanka hwee.
phrase.translation: Truly, it pained turtle a lot but he didnt say anything

phrase.original: ɔhwɛɛ ananse anim kakra na ɔdaa no ase .
phrase.translation: he looked at ananse briefly and thanked him

phrase.original: ɔka kyerɛɛ ananse sɛ berɛ biara ɔbɛfa ne fie ho no ...
phrase.translation: he told spider that anytime he passes around his house ...

phrase.original: ɛyɛ a ɔnwura mu na ɔmbɛdidi
phrase.translation: he should come in to eat

phrase.original: Adufuropɛ nti, akyekyedeɛ asɛm no yɛɛ ananse dɛ
phrase.translation: Because of greed, turtle's issue (the dinner invitation) made spider happy

phrase.original: Da koro bi, ɔyɛɛ n'adwene sɛ ɔbɛkɔ akyekyedeɛ fie akɔdidi.
phrase.translation: one day, he made up his mind that he will go to turtle's house to eat

phrase.original: ɔkɔtoo sɛ akyekyedeɛ da nsuo bi ano reto awia
phrase.translation: he met turtle sunbathing at the bank of a river

phrase.original: Akyekyedeɛ pagyaa ne ti na ɔhuu ananse
phrase.translation: Turtle raised his head and saw spider

phrase.original: ɔmaa no akwaaba bisaa no sɛ aduane no nti na ɔaba anaa
phrase.translation: he welcomed him and asked if he had come because of the food

phrase.original: ma ananse nso kaa sɛ aane
phrase.translation: cause spider to also say yes

phrase.original: Da no nso deɛ na ɛkɔm de ananse yie
phrase.translation: as for that day, spider was very hungry

phrase.original: Akyekyedeɛ kɔɔ ne fie wɔ nsuo no ase kɔtoo pono kamakama bi
phrase.translation: Turtle went to his house which was under the river to set a very nice table

phrase.original: Ankyɛ biara na ɔpue baa nsuo no ani
phrase.translation: It didnt take a long time and he came to the surface of the water

phrase.original: bɛka kyerɛɛ ananse sɛ aduane no abene nti ɔmbɛdidi
phrase.translation: came to tell spider that the food was cooked so he should come and eat

phrase.original: ɛhɔ ara na akyekyedeɛ too ne ho wuraa nsuo no ase
phrase.translation: just then, turtle threw himself into the water (turtle dived into the water)

phrase.original: hyɛɛ aseɛ sɛ ɔredi aduane no
phrase.translation: started to eat the food

phrase.original: Ananse nso too ne ho sɛ ɔrewura nsuo no ase
phrase.translation: Ananse also dived into the water but ...

phrase.original: nanso esiane sɛ nemu yɛ hare no nti
phrase.translation: but because he is not heavy
he couldnt go under it

phrase.original: ɔyɛɛ biara nanso na ɔntumi nwura nsuo no mu
phrase.translation: He did everything but he wasnt able to enter the water (go under the water)

phrase.original: ne nyinaa akyi nso na akyekyedeɛ deɛ ɔredi aduane no
phrase.translation: and beside it all turtle was eating the food

phrase.original: Ananse twaa ne ho twaa ne ho saa
phrase.translation: spider turned himself around several times

phrase.original: na afei adwene bi baa ne tiri mu
phrase.translation: and then an idea came to his mind

phrase.original: ɔhyɛɛ aseɛ sesaa aboɔ guu gyakɛti bi a na ɛhyɛ no mu
phrase.translation: he started to pick stones and put them in a jacket he was wearing
made him heavy (caused him to become heavy)

phrase.original: Esiane sɛ ne mu yɛɛ duru no nti
phrase.translation: because he was heavy

phrase.original: otumi too ne ho too nsuo no ase.
phrase.translation: he was able to go(throw himself) under the water
he went and sat at the table
and there was a lot of food on it

phrase.original: Ananse faa aduane no bi sɛ ɔrebɛdi ara pɛ na akyekyedeɛ kaa sɛ ɔntwɛn
phrase.translation: spider took some of the food to eat then turtle told him to wait
Turtle told him that....
as for his town
we dont wear a Jacket when we are eating
so except he removes it(he has to remove the jacket)

phrase.original: Ananse worɔɔ gyakɛti no ara pɛ
phrase.translation: As soon as spider removed the jacket

phrase.original: Na ɛhurii no bɛtoo nsuo no ani
phrase.translation: and it pushed him to the surface/top of the water
when he looked under the water...

phrase.original: na akyekyedeɛ gu so redi aduane no
phrase.translation: turtle was still eating the food
It really pained ananse
but elders say...

phrase.original: sɛ w'ani te beberee a woma apɔnkye akye
phrase.translation: if you open the eyes too much you wish the goat a good morning
he gave him a chair to sit on it

text.title: Simon's Cat (Asante) (corresponding: EBB_L1.wav) (46 sentences, Release 1.0)

extraMetadata.metadata: A oral narration of the Simon's cat video: "Fly guy".

text.body:
Papa bi da akonwa mu

ᴐkra da ne nan so

Nwansena bi abɛwura dan no mu hᴐ

ᴐkra no ayɛ n’adwene sɛ ᴐbɛkye no

Cup bi si table no so ma ᴐkra no abᴐ cup no ato fam

Nwansena no akᴐtare kanea no ho

ᴐkra no ayɛ n’adwene sɛ ᴐbɛkye nwansena no

Wahuri asᴐ kanea no mu nanso kanea no ahwe fam ama abᴐ

Seisei wakᴐgyina akonwa no atifi

Still aa papa no ada

Nwansena no akᴐtare curtains no so

phrase.translation: A man is sleeping in a chair
phrase.translation2: A man is lying inside a chair

phrase.translation: a cat is lying on his legs/lap
phrase.translation2: There is a cat on his lap

phrase.original: Nwansena bi aba abɛwura dan no mu hᴐ
phrase.translation: A housefly has entered the room

phrase.original: ᴐkra no ayɛ n’adwene sɛ ᴐbɛkye no
phrase.translation: The cat has made up its mind that it will catch it

phrase.original: Cup bi si table no so ma ᴐkra no abᴐ cup no ato fam
phrase.translation: A cup is on the table and the cat has hit it onto the floor
phrase.translation2: A cup is located on the table such that the cat has hit it to the floor

phrase.original: Nwansena no akᴐtare kanea no ho
phrase.translation: The housefly has gone to sit on the lamp
phrase.translation2: The housefly has landed on the lamp

phrase.original: ᴐkra no yɛɛ n’adwene sɛ ᴐbɛkye nwansena no
phrase.translation: The cat decided that it will catch the housefly
phrase.translation2: The cat made up its mind to catch the housefly.

phrase.original: ᴐahuri asᴐ kanea no mu nanso kanea no ahwe hᴐ ama abᴐ
phrase.translation: It has jumped to hold the lamp but the lamp fell down and broke
Now it has gone to stand on top of the chair

phrase.original: Nwansena no akᴐtare curtains no so
phrase.translation: The housefly has gone to stick on the curtains

phrase.original: ᴐkra no rehwɛ nwansena no wᴐ curtains no so
phrase.translation: The cat is looking at the housefly on the curtains
It has decided that it will catch it

phrase.original: ᴐato ne ho ato curtains no so nanso nwansena no atu ama curtains no atete
phrase.translation: It has thrown itself onto the curtains but the housefly has flown away and the curtains have torn

phrase.original: Seisei nwansena no akᴐsi papa no atifi
phrase.translation: Now the housefly has gone to stand above the man
phrase.translation2: The housefly has now gone to land above the man

phrase.original: ᴐkra no afa akonwa no akyi
phrase.translation: The cat has passed behind the chair
It (the cat) has stretched so much that it has come to see the housefly

phrase.original: ᴐyɛɛ sɛ ᴐrekye no nanso nwansena no atu
phrase.translation: It decided that it was going to catch it but the housefly has flown(away)

phrase.original: ᴐkra no ne nwansena no retwan wᴐn ho wᴐ akonwa no so
phrase.translation: The cat and the housefly are running on the chair

phrase.original: nanso deɛ ɛrekᴐ so no nyinaa akyi papa no daso ada a ᴐno deɛ ᴐntee hwee koraa
phrase.translation: But after all that is going on, the man is still asleep such that he hasn't heard anything at all

phrase.original: Seisei nwansena no akᴐtᴐ fam hᴐ
phrase.translation: Now the housefly has fallen down

phrase.original: ᴐkra no ahuri asᴐ nwansena no mu
phrase.translation: The cat has jumped and grabbed the housefly

phrase.original: ᴐakye nwansena no nanso nwansena no asan atu
phrase.translation: It has caught the housefly but the housefly has flown(away) again
Oh! it is hitting the housefly

phrase.original: ᴐabᴐ no ama seisei nwansena no awu
phrase.translation: It has hit it and has caused the housefly to die
phrase.translation2: It (the cat) has hit it(the housefly) and caused it(the housefly), presently, to die

phrase.translation: The cat has rested
It is relieved

phrase.original: ᴐde ne nsa reprɛprɛ nwansena no ahwɛ sɛ ᴐawu a
phrase.translation: It is tapping the housefly with its hand to see if it is dead
No, it is not dead!

phrase.original: ᴐkra no asan abᴐ no ato hᴐ nti ᴐretwan ne ho wᴐ nwansena no ho
phrase.translation: The cat has hit it onto the floor again so it is circling the housefly

phrase.original: ᴐde amirika afa akonwa no akyi
phrase.translation: It has ran past the back of the chair

phrase.original: Afei ᴐkra no akᴐhyɛ paper no ase rehwɛ sɛ nwansena no awu ampa a
phrase.translation: Now the cat has gone hidden under the paper to see if the housefly is really dead
True, the housefly is dead
The cat has gone and looked at the man

phrase.original: ᴐrefrɛ papa no sɛ ᴐnhwɛ sɛ ᴐaku nwansena no
phrase.translation: It is calling the man that he should look that it has killed the housefly
phrase.translation2: it is calling the man to observe that it has killed the housefly

phrase.original: nanso still aa papa no ɛngye so
phrase.translation: But still the man is not responding

phrase.original: nti ᴐatam nwansena no ahyɛ n' ano mu de akᴐto papa no so
phrase.translation: So, it has carried the housefly in its mouth and has put it on the man

phrase.original: ᴐahwɛ ara nso still papa no nsᴐre.
phrase.translation: It has looked(for sometime) but still the man is not getting up

phrase.original: ᴐkra no atam nwansena no ahyɛ papa no ano mu
phrase.translation: The cat has picked up and put the housefly into the man's mouth

phrase.original: Afei deɛ papa no ate n’ani
phrase.translation: Now the man has opened his eyes
He has held his neck

phrase.original: ᴐpɛ sɛ ᴐfe nwansena no nanso ɛmba
phrase.translation: He wants to vomit the housefly but it is not coming(out of his mouth)
Now it has gone/turned to look at the cat

phrase.original: ᴐkra no nso ahwɛ papa no
phrase.translation: The cat has also looked at the man

phrase.original: ᴐaka akyerɛ no sɛ biribi hyɛ n' anum
phrase.translation: It has told him that there is something in his mouth

phrase.original: Papa no de ne nsa asᴐ n’afu
phrase.translation: The man has held his tummy with his hand
phrase.translation2: The man has held his stomach with his hand

phrase.translation: Yet still the man is asleep
The housefly has gotten up again

text.body:

phrase.translation: Kofi cut the trees.

text.title: simon agyinamoa (JOA - Simon's cat.wave new name for JOA_L1_old.wave) (26 sentences, Release 1.0)
text.body:
ɛyɛ fim a wɔato din simon agyinamoa. Papa bi te hɔ na nagyinamoa te ne so. Hwansena bi abɛtwam. Agyinamoa no pɛ sɛ ɔkye hwansens no. waka papa no tii agu fam. wakɔ gyina akonwa no so. Wasan aka kanea no ato fam. ɔpɛ sɛ ɔkye hwansena no. otwitwa nani nanso onhu hwansena. Agyinamoa no ahu hwansena no. wahuri nanso hwansena no adwane. Ogu so hwehwɛ hwansena no. hwansena no akɔ si papa no atifi. Agyinamoa no abɛkye no wɔ hɔ. hwansena no adwane. Agyinamoa no de mirika di hwansena no akyi. Hwansena no asi fam. Agyinamoa no nso asi fam. Sesei agyinamoa no. ɔde ne nsa ɛbobɔ hwansena no. agyinamoa no aku hwansena no. agyinamoa no de hwansena no edi agorɔ. Agyinamoa no de hwansena no ahye nanom. Waforo akonwa no akogyina simon nkɛn. ɔpɛ sɛ onyane simon nanso simon ada. Afei waforo akɔgyina simon atifi. Simon anyane

Agyinamoa no pɛ sɛ ɔkye hwansena no.

ɔaka papa no tii agu fam.

ɔakɔ gyina akonwa no so.

agyinamoa no aka kanea no ato fam.

otwitwa nani nanso onhu hwansena no.

agyinamoa no hwehwɛ hwansena no.

agyinamoa no akye hwansena no.

ɔde ne nsa bobɔ hwansena no.

agyinamoa no de hwansena no di agorɔ.

Agyinamoa no de hwansena no ahyɛ nanum.

ɔaforo akonwa no akɔgyina simon nkɛn.

Afei ɔaforo akɔgyina simon atifi.

phrase.original: ɛyɛ fim a wɔato din simon agyinamoa.
phrase.translation: it is a film titled simon's cat

phrase.original: Papa bi te hɔ na nagyinamoa te ne so.
phrase.translation: a man is sitting with his cat sitting on him
a fly has come to pass / a fly passes by

phrase.original: Agyinamoa no pɛ sɛ ɔkye hwansena no.
phrase.translation: the cat wants to catch the fly

phrase.original: ɔaka papa no tii agu fam.
phrase.translation: it has poured the man's tea on the flooor
it has gone to stand on the chair

phrase.original: agyinamoa no aka kanea no ato fam.
phrase.translation: the cat has (gone down?)
he wants to catch the fly

phrase.original: otwitwa nani nanso onhu hwansena no.
phrase.translation: it is looking around but it cannot find the fly
the cat has seen the fly
the cat looks for the fly

phrase.original: hwansena no akɔ si papa no atifi.
phrase.translation: the fly has gone to sit on top of the man's head

phrase.original: Agyinamoa no abɛkye no wɔ hɔ.
phrase.translation: the cat has come to catch it over there
the fly has run away

phrase.original: Agyinamoa no de mirika di hwansena no akyi.
phrase.translation: the cat is running after the fly
the fly has decended down
the cat too has descended down
the cat has caught the fly

phrase.original: ɔde ne nsa bobɔ hwansena no.
phrase.translation: it hits the fly with the hand
the cat has killed the fly

phrase.original: agyinamoa no de hwansena no di agorɔ.
phrase.translation: the cat is playing with the fly

phrase.original: Agyinamoa no de hwansena no ahyɛ nanum.
phrase.translation: the cat has put the fly into his mouth

phrase.original: ɔaforo akonwa no akɔgyina simon nkɛn.
phrase.translation: it has climb the chair to go stand by simon

phrase.original: ɔpɛ sɛ onyane simon nanso simon ada.
phrase.translation: it wants to wake simon up but simon is asleep
now it has climb to go and stand on top of simon's head

text.title: Sense definitions for an Akan dictionary (Bono)(11 sentences, Release 1.0)
text.body:
Mansa bεpɔn ne ho afi adepam mu afe yi.

ndanwɔtwe nan, ndafua aduonu nwɔtwe;

bere ahorow dumbienu a εka bɔ mu yε afe baako;

sε obi sua adwuma bi wie

na ɔkɔyε amande ma ne wura

nam so gye ne ho

na ɔtumi pae anaa tew ne ho.

na ɔkɔyε amande ma ne wura

nam so gye ne ho

na ɔtumi pae anaa tew ne ho.

phrase.original: Mansa bεpɔn ne ho afi adepam mu afe yi.

a month is a unit of time and consists of approximately 28 days

text.title: Sample sentence taken from the Akan Dictionary (11 sentences, Release 1.0)
text.body:
na ɔkɔyε amande ma ne wura

nam so gye ne ho na ɔtumi pae anaa tew ne ho.

sε obi de dwumadi bi ba awiei na ɔfi bea hɔ.

Sε yεpɔn adwuma a, yεbεnantew akɔ fie.

sε adwumawura ma obi a ne mbere aso (wɔ onyin mu) kwan ma ɔgyae adwuma.

Papa Takyi di mfe aduosia a, wɔbεpɔn no adwuma.

sε obi fi bea bi a εwɔ soro ba fam.

Opoku too ne ho si fii dan no so.

sε adwumawura ma obi a ne mbere aso

(wɔ onyin mu) kwan ma ɔgyae adwuma

sε obi sua adwuma bi wie na ɔkɔyε amande ma ne wura

nam so gye ne ho na ɔtumi pae anaa tew ne ho.

phrase.original: sε obi de dwumadi bi ba awiei na ɔfi bea hɔ.
phrase.translation: It means for someone to bring a work to an end and move away from the place.

phrase.original: Sε yεpɔn adwuma a, yεbεnantew akɔ fie.
phrase.translation: When we close from work we will walk home.

phrase.original: sε adwumawura ma obi a ne mbere aso (wɔ onyin mu) kwan ma ɔgyae adwuma.
phrase.translation: It means for an employer to allow someone who is at his retirement age to retire from work.

phrase.original: Papa Takyi di mfe aduosia a, wɔbεpɔn no adwuma.
phrase.translation: When Mr. Takyi turns 60 he will be made to retire from his work.

phrase.original: sε obi fi bea bi a εwɔ soro ba fam.
phrase.translation: To come down from a higher place.

phrase.original: Opoku too ne ho si fii dan no so.
phrase.translation: Opoku threw himself down from the top of the building.

phrase.original: sε adwumawura ma obi a ne mbere aso
phrase.translation: For an employer to allow someone whose time is up

phrase.original: (wɔ onyin mu) kwan ma ɔgyae adwuma
phrase.translation: to retire and stop working

phrase.original: sε obi sua adwuma bi wie na ɔkɔyε amande ma ne wura
phrase.translation: If someone finish learning a career and goes to perform a profession for the boss

phrase.original: nam so gye ne ho na ɔtumi pae anaa tew ne ho
na ɔkɔyε amande ma ne wura
phrase.translation: And he/she goes to perform rites for his/her boss

phrase.original: nam so gye ne ho na ɔtumi pae anaa tew ne ho.

text.title: ɔkraman ne ne sunsum (16 sentences, Release 1.0)
text.body:
Da koro na ɔkraman bi nenam hwehwɛ aduane. ohuu nankwansere bi. ntɛmtɛm ara no owuraa hɔ kowia dompe kɛse firi ɔpon no so. ɔwe dompe no anigye mu no ɔkɔpue kwae bi mu. ankyɛ na ɔbepue birigi bi ho. ɔretwa birigi no ɔhwɛɛ nsu no mu. na hwɛ dɛn na ohui. ohuu ɔkraman foforo a ɔtesɛ ɔno a dompe hyɛ nano. ɔkraman nibrefo yi yɛɛ nadwen sɛ ɔpɛ saa dompe no nso. nti ɔpɔe dwen sɛ ɔkraman foforo no a ɔwɔ nsu no mu de ehu begyae dompe no mu. na wakɔfa saa dompe no de dompe mmienu no adwane. nanso ɔpɔɔ nea etwa toɔ sɛ ɔde hunahuna ɔkraman foforo no. dompe no firi nano tɔɔ nsu no mu yirae. ɔkraman no wɔ nanibremu faa ne sunsum wɔ nsu no mu sɛ ɔkraman foforo a okura dompe. akyiri ohuu ne gyimmii de ɔkɔm ne abufo kɔe. nanso ohui nyansa kakra.

Unmatched phrases (TC could not identify those phrases and appended them here, feel free to move them around):

na wakɔfa saa dompe no de ndompe mmienu no adwane.

phrase.original: Da koro na ɔkraman bi nenam hwehwɛ aduane.
phrase.translation: one day a dog was wandering around looking for food
he saw a butcher's shop

phrase.original: ntɛmtɛm ara no owuraa hɔ kowia dompe kɛse firi ɔpon no so.
phrase.translation: quickly he entered to steal a fatty juicy bone from the shelf

phrase.original: ɔwe dompe no anigye mu no ɔkɔpue kwae bi mu.
phrase.translation: happily chewing the bone he runs into a forest

phrase.original: ankyɛ na ɔbepue birigi bi ho.
phrase.translation: soon he came across a brige

phrase.original: ɔretwa birigi no ɔhwɛɛ nsu no mu.
phrase.translation: as he crossed the bridge he looked into the river
and behold what did he see

phrase.original: ohuu ɔkraman foforo a ɔtesɛ ɔno a dompe hyɛ nano.
phrase.translation: he saw another dog exactly as him holding a bone in his mouth

phrase.original: ɔkraman nibrefo yi yɛɛ nadwen sɛ ɔpɛ saa dompe no nso.
phrase.translation: the greedy dog decided he wanted that bone too

phrase.original: nti ɔpɔe dwen sɛ ɔkraman foforo no a ɔwɔ nsu no mu de ehu begyae dompe no mu.
phrase.translation: therefore he growled hoping that the other dog in the river will drop the bone out of fear

phrase.original: na wakɔfa saa dompe no de ndompe mmienu no adwane.
phrase.translation: he will then grab the other bone and run away with two bones

phrase.original: nanso ɔpɔɔ nea etwa toɔ sɛ ɔde hunahuna ɔkraman foforo no.
phrase.translation: but as he gave out a last snore to scare off the other dog

phrase.original: dompe no firi nano tɔɔ nsu no mu yirae.
phrase.translation: the bone fell from his mouth into the river, lost forever

phrase.original: ɔkraman no wɔ nanibremu faa ne sunsum wɔ nsu no mu sɛ ɔkraman foforo a okura dompe.
phrase.translation: the dog in his own greed took his own reflection in the river as another dog holding a bone

phrase.original: akyiri ohuu ne gyimmii de ɔkɔm ne abufo kɔe.
phrase.translation: he realised fully too late and walk away hungry and sad
perhaps a little wiser
